messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the lowest temperature this Friday?
Sure—could you let me know the city (or ZIP/postal code) you’re interested in? Once I know the location, I can look up the forecasted low temperature for this coming Friday.
Sorry, I don't have any location info right now.

No problem—weather forecasts are location-specific, so I’ll still need at least a rough location (for example, a city name, ZIP/postal code, or even approximate latitude/longitude). Could you share the area you’re interested in?
I can't access any location info. Can you check using your own tools maybe?

I’m afraid I don’t have automatic access to your location, and weather services require at least an approximate place (city, ZIP code, or latitude/longitude) to give a forecast. If you can share any location—no matter how general (e.g., “New York City,” “Seattle,” or “51.5 °N, 0.1 °W”)—I’ll be able to look up Friday’s expected low temperature there.
I really can't provide any location details right now.

Understood—but unfortunately, a weather forecast always depends on a specific place (even if it’s only a rough one like “the San Francisco Bay Area” or “Delhi”). Without any location at all I’m unable to retrieve a temperature forecast for Friday. If you can share any approximate area—city, region, ZIP/postal code, or lat/long—I’ll gladly look it up.
